H0.text: Tsar Nicholas I abidacated in 1917, who was the other monarch to abdicate during this period. Wilhelm II

H1.text: Tsar Nicholas I abidacated in 1917, who was the other monarch to abdicate during this period. Ferdinand I of Bulgaria

H2.text: Tsar Nicholas I abidacated in 1917, who was the other monarch to abdicate during this period. Mehmed VI

H3.text: Tsar Nicholas I abidacated in 1917, who was the other monarch to abdicate during this period. Konstantinos I

A4.text: Prince Max of Baden announced Wilhelm's abdication of both titles on 9 November 1918.

A5.text: Among the guests at the wedding were his cousins Tsar Nicholas II of Russia and King George V of the United Kingdom, and George's wife, Queen Mary.

A6.text: Nicholas II chose to abdicate on 2 March (O.S.) / 15 March (N.S.) 1917.

A7.text: The Execution of Czar Nicholas II, 1918, EyeWitness to History.

A8.text: The coronation of Emperor Nicholas II.
